page.title: 04THE MACHINE YEAR
page.content: The bale fork is put on the front end of a tractor and stacks the flat pattern of eight bales into five layers. The bail carrier at the back lifts forty bails at a time to stack in a barn or pile. The plough is pulled behind a tractor and cuts and turns the earth. This burries any remaining stubble. A harrow is some discs pulled by a tractor. These chop up the clods of dirt. Rolls are pulled by a tractor. These are heavy cylinders which flatten the field. Drills are pulled by a tractor, this makes holes in the ground and plants the seeds in them.
